title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 9500.6 - Preliminary consultation before initial review
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 9500.6 - Preliminary consultation before initial review

State Regulations
(a) Any project sponsor may ask the
commission for a confidential preliminary consultation and for preliminary
approval or recommendations with respect to the project. The project sponsor
shall submit to the commission a description of the project and a map (of a
scale of one inch equals one mile or larger) showing project location and data
concerning dimensions of any proposed structures. (b) The commission shall notify the sponsor
in writing, if the project is subject to review or not. If the project is
subject to review, the commission will offer the sponsor the opportunity to
discuss the project informally. (c) The commission shall inform the sponsor of any recommendations it may have and
of other public agencies having review responsibilities concerning the
project. (d) If the commission
gives preliminary approval to the project, it shall notify the sponsor in
writing. Such approval shall not relieve the sponsor from the necessity of
submitting the project for initial review. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
9500.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
